intro: Batesanthus talbotii var. grandifolius, commonly known as the Talbot's batesanthus, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in shaded woodland areas. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
